oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Commemorations; Exhibition buildings; Exhibit booths; Machinery; Engine rooms
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small black and white photograph of the Machinery Building at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition.

The Machinery Building was of Greek-Doric style architecture and displayed machinery of every variety. Two innovations displayed were a round-bale cotton press and an automatic gear-cutting machine. The engines inside the building furnished all the power to operate every electric light, as well as the arc lights on the ground.
